author: Mollie Russell
description:
Meow Wolf, one of the art world’s most unique collectives, has announced a reality-shifting new tabletop RPG based on its signature style. Tavers: The Meow Wolf Roleplaying Game promises to help players explore bizarre, logic-defying worlds through alternate reality portals. A press release from August 15 promises that the game will hit Kickstarter in spring 2026, and it’ll feature everything from “immortal cybernetic hamsters” to “sentient pizza”.

Continue reading Art group Meow Wolf announces psychedelic TTRPG, complete with sentient pizza
MORE FROM WARGAMER: The best tabletop RPGs, D&D classes guide, Pathfinder classes guide
title: Art group Meow Wolf announces psychedelic TTRPG, complete with sentient pizza

author: Matt Bassil
description:
A Youtube group has found a way to make Warhammer even more expensive: combining it with Lego!

The Yogscast created two full armies entirely from Lego (or compatible Lego alternatives) and smushed them together for a battle report on its Games Night channel.

Continue reading Nerdy YouTube icons The Yogscast plays Warhammer 40k using nothing but Lego
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Warhammer 40k starter sets, Best Warhammer 40k games, All Warhammer 40k factions
title: Nerdy YouTube icons The Yogscast plays Warhammer 40k using nothing but Lego

author: Mollie Russell
description:
Dungeons and Dragons is, at its heart, an improv game where anything can happen. Your players might slay the dragon, or they might marry it and settle down in a peaceful commune. The roll of the dice can drastically alter the outcome of key events. From session to session, the Dungeon Master barely knows what’ll happen next – so how are you supposed to cope when your D&D party can literally see the future?

Continue reading A DnD Dungeon Master's guide to surviving divination spells
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review, DnD classes guide, DnD races guide
title: A DnD Dungeon Master's guide to surviving divination spells

author: Matt Bassil
description:
The Magic: The Gathering card Scrapheap has leapt up in price. Valued at only one dollar before the latest set came out, according to MTG Goldfish, it has since seen a steady increase to $10.10, a 910% rise. Foils are apparently going for as much as $60.

Continue reading Old MTG artifact card from 1999 sees 900% price rise
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: Old MTG artifact card from 1999 sees 900% price rise

author: Matt Bassil
description:
The Pokémon Company has dropped a teaser trailer for the next Pokémon Pocket set, and just like the physical Trading Card Game, this one is all about Mega Evolutions. Billed as a new season for the mobile app, Pokémon TCG Pocket: Mega Evolutions is advertised for this Fall, but no specific release date has been announced.

Continue reading Pokémon Pocket unveils Mega Evolutions that could instantly lose you the game
MORE FROM WARGAMER: How many Pokémon are there?, How to play Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards
title: Pokémon Pocket unveils Mega Evolutions that could instantly lose you the game

author: Jasmine Mannan
description:
Looking for a board game that respects your time, space, and wallet? Pandemic: Hot Zone - Europe, a smaller spin-off of the classic co-op game, is 60% at Amazon. US tabletop fans can currently grab the game for less than $8 - if they're quick.

Continue reading Grab this bite-sized Pandemic board game spin-off at a tasty 60% off
title: Grab this bite-sized Pandemic board game spin-off at a tasty 60% off
